result.execSummary:
The defendant Erich Nmi Gramer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Computer Message-Threaten/Obscenity, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.0125(2)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Erich Nmi Gramer

defendant.name: Gramer, Erich Nmi
defendant.address: N3353 Indian Echoes Ln, Montello, WI 53949

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Erich Nmi Gramer in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that an offer was provided and he believes the matter is resolved today.  Defendant would like to accept the offer.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement.  Defendant agrees.  
  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.    Defendant waives their right to an attorney and wants to proceed today.  Court accepts defendant's waiver.  Defendant enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty.

  State has complied with victim notification requirements and gives the statement to the court.
Court reads the statement.

BY THE COURT:  Pay fine and costs = $442.00
bond to be applied
Defendant will pay the balance today.
Return date on April 1, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Erich Nmi Gramer in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  

BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

Court questions the defendant.    Defendant waives their right to an attorney in order to have a conference with the District Attorney.
BY THE COURT:  Set for Return.  Return date scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
